summary: This bill, the Coastal Communities Ocean Acidification Act of 2025, amends the Federal Ocean Acidification Research And Monitoring Act of 2009. It focuses on improving collaboration among federal, state, and local governments, as well as with Indian Tribes and Native Hawaiian organizations, on vulnerability assessments, research planning, and other activities related to ocean acidification and its impacts on coastal communities.  The bill also modifies definitions and board membership to include Indigenous representation and establishes an ongoing mechanism for input from affected groups.
